cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles ENE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast tonight, then turning northeast on Monday while staying offshore of Florida and Georgia and approaching the Outer Banks of North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the Outer Banks, North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: None (a Tropical Storm Warning may be issued later for portions of the NC coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East-central Florida northward through coastal Georgia and the Carolinas, greatest impact expected Outer Banks NC
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of sustained 20–30 mph winds with occasional 35–40 mph gusts possible Sunday morning as the center passes east of Jacksonville
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the immediate beaches and inlets; significant inundation not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Light rainfall generally less than 1 inch, locally higher in outer rainbands
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Northeast Florida beaches
